website_summaries.verdict: A one-of-a-kind projector mount that delivers a terrific combination of affordability and durability.
pros: Features 4 adjustable arms, ensuring the mount can be used with most projectors
Mount's ceiling plate is stamped out in the middle to make it easy to organize all of your projector cables
Capable of supporting projectors up to 65 pounds
Steel construction delivers exceptional strength and stability
cons: Intended for use with vaulted ceilings only

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service follow through!
customer_reviews.text: When the box arrived it was obvious that it was a used mount. I assume it had been returned and then sent out to me. Because of this pieces were missing and it was scratched and marred. After attempting to install it I learned that the ball portion does not fit well and the adjustment is difficult. It seems that it is sturdy, but using for new and receiving used is not good. UPDATE: Cheetah not only sent me a new mount that worked perfectly they also sent some really slick HDMI connectors. This is a very sturdy mount. Would not hesitate buying from Cheetah again! I am giving them a"Mulligan" on the first mount...
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Takes some thought when mounting
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for temporarily mounting a close throw projector on a theatre lighting batten for digital backdrops. It took some time to work out attaching the mounting bracket to the actual projector since the mounting plate on the projector wasn't a normal square or rectangle shape. Other than that, it's pretty sturdy and versatile. I will use it again when I need to mount another projector in the theatre. Price wise, it's a terrific value and cheaper than renting a mount when renting a projector!
customer_reviews.author: Ellijay, GA

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this mount for a little over a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this mount for a little over a year now. It came with ample amount of mounting hardware to install for various configurations but my overall problem has been with the mount itself. The ball and pinion on this is severely undersized for holding the majority of home theater projectors. I have the screws on the ball and pinion tightened down as far as possible but there is still a few inches of play which making it line up correctly with my screen near impossible. I think if you have a small projector this mount might be sufficient, but stay clear of this one if you have a larger projector.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but quick release hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Used to mount on steep cabana ceiling and able to tilt and adjust despite the big angle needed. One problem was the quick release sleeve Is on projector mount and slides down due to gravity while attempting to secure to the ceiling mount. Need another set of hands to install with this “quick release” feature which separates due to gravity while attempting to screw in the anchor bolts. Better design would have been to flip the sleeve to the the ceiling mount so it worked with gravity.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K.

customer_reviews.title: Hell - Not Compatible for Optoma Projectors - RESOLVED
customer_reviews.text: NOT A UNIVERSAL PROJECTOR !!! This product is not compatible for most optoma projectors (Mainly for UHD50 and UHD60), i recently bought UDH50 it was like a hell to install this mount. As i hired handy man i need to stick with this projector. **MISSING HARDWARE** Bought a new hardware (M4 18mm) from home-depot and cut existing hard ware to fit for UDH50. This all took more than 5-6 hrs just to install a single mount. I wouldn't recommend this product if you are going with Optoma (not sure of other brands) *** Updated Review *** Unbelievable customer service, team followed up the issue i'm facing - immediately refunded and promised to take of Optoma Projects screw structure.
customer_reviews.author: Srikanth

customer_reviews.title: Good brand, great projector mount!
customer_reviews.text: After using a Cheetah TV mount and knowing the quality and ease of use i had with that mount, i decided to try this projector mount. This is a very well made mount and it gives us alot of options if we need to move it and articulate the projector and the versatility it offers with the adjustable extention is great too. A mount of this quality i would expect to cost much more than what we paid. We are very happy with this product and it works as advertised and exceeded our expectations and for that i gave it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M

customer_reviews.title: Low price but solid construction
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install and adjusts for a universal mount to any standard projector. Came with hardware for several different sizes. Good product. UPDATE: Customer service reached out to me on several occasions without being prompted. This is an excellent company to do business with and they assured me that they are working on the mounting pole stability. Definitely 5 stars for customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Rowland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and durrable
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and durrable. We are using it with a BenQ short throw. There's lots of different parts to get this to fit perfectly. My husband does advise buyers to not use the supplied anchors but to go to your local hardware store and get toggle bolts. This is not to say the supplied anchors are not good enough but lets face it, if you shell out the money to build your dream home theater system you want want to know for sure your expensive equipment stays put. Great mount all the way around. Lots of parts and options to get the perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Poor compatibility with projectors that have 3-point mounts
customer_reviews.text: If your projector only has a three-point mounting system (like the Optoma HD142X that is Amazon's most popular model at the time of this writing), you're really going to have a hard time getting this mount to work properly. I had to remove one arm from the mount and turn one of the arm ends around backwards to make everything fit, and even then it was an ordeal. If you have a projector with a 3-point mount, I would buy something made for it specifically and not this universal mount.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well with Optoma HD28
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these mounts installed it and mounted my Optoma HD28 projector. It is not a heavy projector at all. I made sure everything was tight and snug. Still the projector doesn't stay in place. It kept drooping a little down slowly. It was moving the picture outside the frame for me.I called the customer service and they sent a free unit. But it has the same exact problem. I think there is something wrong with the design or between my projector model and this mount. I got tired of adjusting it and finally removed the frame so even thought the picture moved I wouldn't notice!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Gundala

customer_reviews.title: Very good ceiling mount
customer_reviews.text: I used this mount for my 1080p Optima projector. I did have some trouble attaching the rod to the joint due to the ball bearing being very still. So heads up that you may need to work with the ball bearing a lot to get it to be pushed down enough to attach. The tightening screws for the mounted projector can get a little loose sometime if not enough pressure is applied when tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Almonz D. Lemaitre

customer_reviews.title: Nice mount for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice mount for a projector, and you can't beat the price. The hardware is good, and the white color doesn't stand out too much against our white projector and ceiling. I wish it had a shorter pipe option in addition to the two longer ones. A pipe of about six inches as an option would have been ideal. It also comes with a bonus 15 ft braided rope covered HDMI cable.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Easterling Collins

customer_reviews.title: Doest the job, but it's not great.
customer_reviews.text: This mount is just ok. It has a ball and socket type mount which, if you look at it wrong, will be thrown off...It's a pain to get it setup and there is a lot of movement within all of the connection points. I don't have any other experience with projector mounts, but this one doesn't seem very solid to me. There is movement at the ceiling connection where the pipe hangs down as well no matter how tight you make it. I also added a safety cable connected to a separate eye-bolt into the ceiling because I just don't trust it. I would not buy it again...
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay in place!
customer_reviews.text: Poor design causes it to shift after tightening adjustments, so it’s an absolute guess. Took me a half hour to adjust aiming my projector properly, and it’s only held in place with a ball joint that is sure to slowly rotate. Infuriating product. Once it settles, I may try to fill gaps with hot glue or something. So annoyed. Not worth buying cheap.
customer_reviews.author: CO

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Try as I may, there is not way to get this product to tighten down enough to keep the projector from wobbling. So you will spend some time continually trying to position the projector until it is just right. Just don't EVER touch it again, because the slightest touch will bump it out of alignment. An inferior design at best. I got it to work, but I would not purchase it again. Would NOT recommend. EDIT: I have to say that this company does have good customer service. After seeing my review they did work with me to adjust for the faulty product. Updating from 2 star to 4 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L

customer_reviews.title: Universal, Sturdy and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: It was kinda over kill for my mini projector, but this mount is SOLID... it will easily hold a full size projector. It came with a 15ft HDMI cable, lens wipe and led key chain. It was easy to install and would fit a wide variety of mount holes. As a universal mount it is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Steven van

customer_reviews.title: White paint prevents mount from fitting properly
customer_reviews.text: I have just opened up this mount and it is very solid and seems well made. There is a real problem, however. As is, it will not function because of the fitting that is supposed to go down into the socket to cover the ball joint will not at all fit. I will sand down the edge of the male part to make it fit but out of the box, I can't use it. You can see the paint scraped off the edge where I have tried too make it fit. Disappointed but will make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Flown Over

customer_reviews.title: Loose hardware makes for a tough installation. Spend the money for a higher quality.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I have purchased Cheetah mounts for my flat screens and they did the job, but when I installed this projector mount, I wasn't impressed. After doing all of my measurements, I drilled this into my ceiling beams, and after messing with it a bit I got it to fit onto my Epson projector. Once mounted, the hardware for the arm, and side to side ball bearing would not tighten to keep the projector at my preferred angle. I was forced to manipulate my projectors settings A LOT in order to get my picture to quality. I will be upgrading to a higher quality mount soon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I thought this mount was nice, until I had to install it on the ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this mount was nice, until I had to install it on the ceiling. No matter what, the projector does not sit tightly. I can tighten the screws in the correct position, but there is still play and the projector is able to move about, making it EXTREMELY frustrating to try to fit it within a screen/frame on the wall. I would steer clear of this product for this reason. I bought it about a month ago, and I just missed out on the replace time. Not too happy about that!
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: For the price it is good, the bad part is you need to have ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is good, the bad part is you need to have the nuts tight so it does not wiggle but when you tighten it the pipe bends in. It took a bit to find the happy medium. The fine adjustment is not that great so I have to put some electrical tape to keep it from moving and have it tight. All the trouble is worth not paying three to four times as much for a mount. UPDATE: First gave a three star review and seller contacted me because the issue I had is not normal. I am working with the seller to get a replacement. I am confident that we will get the issue resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Gazingwolf1623

customer_reviews.title: I like this mount it is sturdy and comes with enough ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this mount it is sturdy and comes with enough pieces to mount just about anywhere you would want. I have three other Cheetah Mount products as well in my offices and they are all good quality. The reason I only gave it 4 stars is due to the fact it was difficult to find the right configuration for my projector, actually I had to fabricate a non-existent configuration but I found a way to make it work, to be fair it is probably the projector company that made it hard for a generic brand mount to fit their equipment. The only other thing that would be nice is if they made a sleeve/ring to cover over the bracket.
customer_reviews.author: JWoods

customer_reviews.title: Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: Originally rated at 2 stars. The design is sturdy and adjustable. But it would have been way more stars if one of the holes that secures the four "legs" was tapped properly. I didn't have a 10-32 tap kit so I had to drill it one size larger and use another nut and bolt. Oh well. A representative was very prompt in reaching out to me to correct this issue!!! This must have been a very infrequent case of missed quality control. Finally, the HDMI cable supplied is absurdly... rigid and stiff. Works fine, I just found it's lack of flexibility odd.
customer_reviews.author: Anton

customer_reviews.title: Great mount (hehe)
customer_reviews.text: Using this with a BenQ TK 800 and it works great, but you can tell it's easily customizable for just about any size projector. It sits pretty close to the ceiling without the extension, which is what I needed for now, but having it for later is a plus. The HDMI cable that was included was 15' and definitely heavy duty. It's easy to adjust once it's up, but really not a quick-release type of mount.
customer_reviews.author: OV

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, no issues, just follow the instructions. Comes with a safety clip so you're projector should never fall on the floor in case the attachment does somehow come loose. Extension pole turned out not to be necessary with my standard 8' ceiling. Great price, no complaints. I didn't have 4 mounting holes on my Epson like other projectors so I just swung 2 of the arms back out of view and it holds just fine with 2 arms.
customer_reviews.author: AMoore

customer_reviews.title: Better than costlier items
customer_reviews.text: This thing is built like a tank and handled our forty pound old NEC beast of a projector with no problem. The only issue of note was that it was longer than we needed. Like another previous review mentioned, it was no problem to cut five inches off both supporting tubes to make it the exact length we needed.
customer_reviews.author: David Ward

customer_reviews.title: secure those connecting parts
customer_reviews.text: myself included, felt uneasy about the connections. several people have mentioned that the projector even fell because they thought the parts were properly attached. you need to detach most of the pieces and reattach them one by one in order. easier if you see the pictures i uploaded
customer_reviews.author: randomx

customer_reviews.title: After a little calibration it is working fantastic. I love the HDMI cable that came with ...
customer_reviews.text: 2017 Update- The mount is still working well on our second projector (BenQ DLP 1080p) and second house.. As written below the mount has some movement, which would put this at 4 stars. I can still fanangle it to exactly what I want so I'm keeping it at 5 stars. The HDMI cable is still working like a champ. For the price you can't go wrong. It doesn't perfectly adjust and I had to tighten the bolts to the point of squishing the bar. After a little calibration it is working fantastic. I love the HDMI cable that came with it and the packaging was fantastic. It fit our Epson HomeCinema 710HD.
customer_reviews.author: RBG Family

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mount
customer_reviews.text: I previously boughtand that mount was absolutely terrible. This mount, is not. In fact, this mount is awesome. It includes the extension pole, which I didn't realize. The mount comes pre-assembled and is very easy to work with. I used lag bolts to install it, rather than the included bolts, just because that was easier for me. One big plus to this kit is that all the bolts and screws come separately packaged and are clearly labeled. It adjusts in many different ways. So far I'm real happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: I recommend placing the mount plate first to ceiling
customer_reviews.text: Works for my Optoma hd26. You might have to get creative on how to set it up. I recommend placing the mount plate first to ceiling. Then add universal mount for projector. And screw in place. Very easy to adjust. You will have extra pieces. I did not use the extender. Mine came with 2 clasps one that was connected to the mount attached to projector and the other one loose. Use the other clasp on the wall mount portion. My projector weighs 5lbs. The clasps were able to hold its weight and secure it. I tested it and the cord did not break after 40 min of weight drop from projector.
customer_reviews.author: Jas

customer_reviews.title: Good solid ceiling mount
customer_reviews.text: I made it work. It was to long so I had to cut it with a hacksaw. In the end it looks great but it was lots of work to install. You should be able to make it work for almost every projector but you have to be creative. It Doesn't hold project completely steady. After a year Cheetah followed up on my review. They had great customer service and really made things right. My understanding is they have improved the bracket so there isn't a wiggle on it. I will install my new bracket soon and have a new update. For now I'm giving them 1 more star for customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Fister

customer_reviews.title: Returned Right Away
customer_reviews.text: The way this is made was very sketchy to me. We tried it out and there is no good way to get the main head to lock and stay. It constantly is trying to balance and will not stay in place. This also made it seem very unsteady and not secure.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Headley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value for $25 and was easy to set up and works great. It comes with long and short arm connectors for big and small projectors. Used the short armed ones on an Epson. I loved that it came with a 15' hdmi cable and a little safety cable just in case, I attached to an eye hook I screwed into my floor joist in the ceiling. Thanks for a great product at an extremely reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: RKE17

customer_reviews.title: Works, sort of...
customer_reviews.text: It does work as advertised... Don't be cheap. Buy the mount made for your projector. I tried this and then immediately forked over $120 for the Epson mount for my Epson projector. There is no comparison is how much nicer and easier to use the Epson mount is. This mount is hard to get to stay where you want it. But if you're a major cheap skate and don't care about that, this could be the mount for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Don't get fooled by $160 dollar premium junk ... get this one instead!
customer_reviews.text: Will try to keep this very short and to the point. If you find yourself in Best Buy or some other shop and see a projector mount for $160 bucks (like I did) and you spend a bunch of time mounting that (like I did) and you find yourself disappointed in the quality of that mount (like I did), then return it to Best Buy and buy this instead. This easy to use and high quality mount worked great for my Epson 2045 projector ... much much better than the big box store's supposedly premium version. Five Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Ruvuz

customer_reviews.title: Plenty sturdy and lots of parts for flexibility in mounting
customer_reviews.text: Plenty sturdy and lots of parts for flexibility in mounting. You get 3 sets of screws to match the mounting holes in your projector. Unfortunately my BenQ had M8 holes so it was a trip to HD for those. The socket for the ball mount had burrs that prevented inserting the ball which had to be filed off. There also should have been one more screw holding the extendable tubes to prevent wobble. Another HD trip. The directions are virtually useless. If you don't have a bent for mechanical stuff, this assembly isn't for you. That said, I'm quite happy with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: C W Morse

customer_reviews.title: Works well and easy install...
customer_reviews.text: So I loved how quick and easy the instal was and putting it together. The replacement I got fixed all my issues and now when I close the door to the garage through my utility room the projector doesn’t move. Yes I know why I’m garage but it was for my man cave to play games drink vape etc with out upsetting the wife
customer_reviews.author: DeeBroadway

customer_reviews.title: Works great. The only thing I recommend
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The only thing I recommend...pay attention to where your lens is. I hung the mount centered on my screen but forgot that the lens is off the the right, not centered. I put some big old holes in the ceiling that I just didn't feel like fixing, so my projector is off center.
customer_reviews.author: NathanW

customer_reviews.title: Outfreakingstanding
customer_reviews.text: This mount far exceeded my expectations. The fit, finish and function are vastly superior to the mount it’s replacing and at a cost of only $5 more. Add in the free HDMI cable and you have yourself one heck of a deal. If you are curious, here’s a link to the one I’m replacing.  It’s junk. Seriously. GET THE CHEETAH!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Redcon1

customer_reviews.title: Not fully universal
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit my projector. I feel like I have the most common projector too. I bought a medium quality projector from Walmart’s limited selection. I had to modify the brackets myself by drilling holes and adjusting arm placement. It does hold well after modifying it though.
customer_reviews.author: Bart

customer_reviews.title: Solid projector mount!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mount! I read so many reviews in miunt before landing on the idea of purchasing one of these. At first it did took a bit of time to figure out the connection to muont to my projector. I ended up taking out the extension legs, flip the mount upside down and from there it wasnt much more that i had to figure out. I followed the recommendation from reivews in twisting the tightening screws slowly on both side. My projector has been mount led and had not move for tge last 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Johnny D.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Assembly took a little longer than I expected. The material is very sturdy and secure. Adjusting it to fit my projector was a breeze. The HDMI cable that it came with didn't work. The image would turn on and off for several seconds at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Hang it from the ceiling!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product with everything you need to install. I read the review before purchasing and I understand how tough it can be to install the adapter plates, but everything is included for most any combo. Seems like the mounting options are for concrete or stud only. No drywall ceiling support. I started out wanting to mount to drywall but quickly changed my mind do to the thought of my investment crashing down. Not heavy, but still some decent weight to it. I had access to the ceiling so I was able to cut a few 2x4’s to put between the joists. After I got the support figured out everything went up in minutes and dialed just as quick too!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Always a great brand to trust at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is about the fifth mount that I have purchased from Cheetah Mounts over the past few years. This has become a brand that I have come to trust, which is what you want, when it is holding up your expensive electronic equipment. This particular mount fit my projector great and offered plenty of fine tuning for me to get my angle just right. I was able to hang the projector without any assistance, and I'm very happy with the overall finished product. When you consider the price difference vs brands available at the big box stores, there's no competition.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy fitment.
customer_reviews.text: The down tubes are thin-walled. Two bolts attach at the top and two attach at the bottom. When tightening the bolts the thin tubes collapse so that when one bolt is tight the other becomes loose. Had to find a balance point that was less than sufficient to firmly hold the projector. Very sloppy fit. Finally got it good enough. It is now mounted, but would not buy again. However, I did appreciate the 15-ft HDMI cable they sent with it.
customer_reviews.author: tljidaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value - very versatile
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile and adjustable. Had to get creative with it to mount my Epson 1060, but it had more than enough parts and adjustment to do a clean looking, solid mount.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: I don't like hanging the projector by the thumb screws
customer_reviews.text: HDMI Cable did not work (picture was cutting out but stopped when I swapped the cable). Extension bars to not lock together so it's wobbly. I don't like hanging the projector by the thumb screws. The metal wire used as a safety mechanism is oddly short, one end is a cheap clip. I'm not even sure what to do with it. Difficult to get the properly angle when mounting the projector.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great mount- easy setup, solid construction.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. I've installed some Chief mounts which are about 10x as expensive. The chief mounts are great for large projectors in auditoriums- I don't think I'd trust this mount with a large projector. But for smaller home-style projectors, this thing is a no brainer. Easy to setup, flexible, simple adjustments. It really worked fantastic for the classroom I installed it in.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Van Pelt

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and works perfectly with my Epson Power Lite 710HD
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion you can't beat this for the price. Very sturdy and versatile. My projector only has three mount points and it was very easy to remove the 4th arm and connect the remaining three. Came with a variety of screw sizes and fortunately one of the sizes matched up to my projector perfectly. Very easy to adjust once mounted.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but has some play
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this mount to go with my optoma hd28dse and can't seem to get it to hold the projector in the same spot for more than a few days. I'm constantly having to readjust this mount as it shifts. Mount is secured to the ceiling in my theater room using 3" lag bolts and that is great just seems to be where the pivot ball mounts the projector base. Update: received an updated version of this mount and must say that it is much better quality and holds projector position very well
customer_reviews.author: cj

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a used item with original box like new but it seemed that they opened the box and closed it because everything was very well packed it came with everything that you will need aswell as extras for different size projectors. It even came with a keychain light. also a cloth to clean the projector lens. The quality is solid. For the price of 15 dollars you can't go wrong. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: leobardo nova

customer_reviews.title: Misleading - Does not fit the Epson 2045
customer_reviews.text: When I was looking for a projector mount for my Epson 2045, this mount came up. But it does not fit the Epson 2045 at all and on top of that did not come with any screws that would be used to attach the projector. The 2045 has a middle hole that this mount covers. Seller should NOT say that it is universal, its misleading. Now I need to return this :(
customer_reviews.author: Furtim Vigilans

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: This mount is just okay for me. I lit holds the projector but doesn’t stay where I position it. Whenever I take my hand off the projector it falls just a bit. That’s the reason I gave it 3 stars. I fixed the issue by moving my screen. Easy fix but the mount moves a bit too much and there is no way to tighten it so that the projector stays where you put it. This wasn’t a super huge deal to me, but it is something that buyers should be aware of.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a great mount. Mine came with the HDMI cable shown. I used this to mount a Optoma HD131Xe which has a three hole mount. To get a smaller span between mount point just flip the interchangeable legs 180 degrees so they point in. You can flip the legs in any combo needed to get the right spacing. The only complaint I have is that the height adjustment isn't on an infinite slide like some of the others... it has to line up with the bolt holes for spacing. Still a great value compared to the others costing 2-3 times or more.
customer_reviews.author: CarlU

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy mount.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy mount...the directions were a bit tricky when it came to attaching the bracket piece to attach to the projector with the ceiling mount part. But once I figured that out all was well. My projector only had three holes and the mount allowed me to take off one of the arms quickly to accomodate. Also the HDMI cable is great with a long reach! The only downside was that the anchors included aren't effect in drywall as they just spin around when you try to put the large screws/bolts into the ceiling so I had to go to the hardware store for better anchors. All in all a good purchase...excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ShimmShamm

customer_reviews.title: Great deal great quality
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty holds my projector very secure comes with projector wipe and 15ft HDMI cord. Also comes with safety cable and nice lag bolts. I can almost hang off of it. No parts missing.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't mount from ceiling unless you are a capable handyperson and takes safety seriously. If not, get someone qualified to do it
customer_reviews.text: Product is very sturdy and durable. Comes with all necessary hardware plus 2 nifty tools so you don't have to find your own. Assembling was intuitive, except getting the swivel head to lock in place took a while to figure out, this being my first time dealing with projector mounts. Can be mounted on flat or sloped ceilings or even walls. I actually purchased it to mount on a tripod (the kind built for speakers) and it has enough parts and holes and hardware to make it work in a number of ways.
customer_reviews.author: 5kL

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me with elbow grease

product_meta.title: Cheetah Mounts APMEB Universal Projector Ceiling Mount Includes a 27" Adjustable Extension Pole and a Twisted Veins 15' HDMI Cable
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe APMEB Universal Projector Mount is one of a kind. We designed this mount to be 100% universal and compatible with all Projectors on the market. The Four Connection Components can be extended or retracted to attach to the mounting holes on the projector. Additionally, some Projectors have only three mounting holes but with this mount, using all four connection components is not necessary. The mounting plate also features a 0-90 degree turn for recessed installation. Our APMEB supports up to 65LBS and constructed of 100% High-Grade Steel.
feature_bullets: Universal Design with Four Adjustable Arms: The arms are fully adjustable to fit virtually any projector. The arms are also removable for projectors that have less than 4 mounting points.

7" Low Profile and Optional Adjustable Extension Pole: The APMEB is ideal for low profile mounting as well as setups that require an extension pole. The profile is 7" without the extension. With the extension, the profile has an adjustable range of 18.75-27".
Cable Management: The center of the ceiling plate is stamped out to allow cables to pass through for a clean and sleek cable management system.
Vaulted Ceiling Plate: The APMEB is designed so it may be used with vaulted ceilings.
Safety Cable: Attach the projector to the mount with the metal tether for added security during installation. The cable may also be used as an extra element of security once the projector is mounted.
